page.title: 18Population and Employment
page.content: Total population 121, of whom 25 (20%) are children;76(63%) of working age; 20(15%) are retired.15 of the children are at school, mainly local schools in Dulverton, Bampton and East Anstey; one is at University.34(28%) are in employment-21 men and 13 women. The majority work in farming and related services(agricultural mach- inery hire and repairs).Service indust ries(catering, filling station) employ 8 people. Self-employed(16) make up 44% of the total employed. Several farming partnerships are found, in farming (with husband, wife and sons all work- ing on the farm), and in running a restaurant. 8 people are employed as farmworkers 4 work in teaching and managerial jobs. All but two work in the neigh- bourhood.
